result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacy M. Weronke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF69 and 14CF243.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacy M. Weronke in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-69, 14CF-243, 14CF-244 and 14CM-107.

8:44 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
14CF-69 - State has filed an amended information, amending the charge.

Defendant will plead to 14CF-69.

14CF-243 Defendant will plead to Count 3. Count 1 and Count 2 dismissed and read in

14CF-244 -Defendant will plead to Count 1. Cts 2-3 dismissed and read in

14CM-107 - Defendant will plead to single count

Atty Drengler concurs with plea agreement.
Atty Drengler has received a copy of the amended information in 14CF-69 and waives the reading.
Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-69 Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-243 Count 3.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-244 Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CM-107 Count 1.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-69 Amended Count 1 943.50(1m)(b)
14CF-243 Count 3 946.49(1)(a)
14CF-243 Count 1 and Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-244 Count 1 947.01(1)
14CF-244 Count 2 and Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CM-107 Count 1 813.12(3) and 8(a)

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court agrees with sentence recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-69:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Maintain full time employment or full time schooling or combination to equal full time
Participate in any counseling as recommended by the agent
Not to be on the premises of Kohls Department Store in Plover
Pay court costs
60 days to pay

14CF-243 
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 months concurrent to 14CF-69
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 14CF-69
No contact with Mr. Terrence Blackman except for respect to child issues. Any contact is to be consistent with the family court order.
Pay fine of $250 plus costs
$250 Bond on deposit is to be applied
Balance to be paid within 60 days

14CF-244
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 months concurrent to 14CF-69 and 14CF-243
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-69 and 14CF-243
Pay court costs

14CM-107
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 months concurrent to 14CF-69 and 14CF-243 and 14CF-244
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-69, 14CF-243 and 14CF-244
Pay court costs
60 days to pay
Serve 45 days jail
6 days jail credit
Huber granted for work, school and child care
Jail to be served within the first 12 months of probation and start date is to be worked out between Defendant, Agent and Jail
Entire amount may be served on home detention
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jacy M. Weronke in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF243, 14CF244  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued.

Defendant Jacy M. Weronke in court with attorney Sean Drury. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF243 & 14CF244.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaints.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Court notes bond was set and posted in 14CF243 with conditions. 
Intern Kraus asks that the bond in 14CF243 cover both files now. 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Jacy M. Weronke not in court. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Drury says she was here this morning.  Notice stated branch 32.  Matter rescheduled.
